Class MazeGuy

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeGuy

  • public class MazeGuy
extends java.lang.Object
    The MazeGuy class is responsible for handling all logic for traversing the maze. With the exception of the variables "breadCrumb" and "currentLocationMarker" the class will not directly interact with the maze created by the Maze class. Instead it calls methods from the Maze class with parameters to tell it what to do
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Method Detail

      • mazeTraversal

        public void mazeTraversal(int currentXLocation,
                          int currentYLocation,
                          java.lang.String lastMove)
        Recursive method used to solve traverse the maze. Each "turn" the method will check for a valid direction to move. If there is one, it will call the breadCrumb method, marking the position the mazeGuy will be moving from, and recalls mazeTraversal. In the event that method detects it has reached a dead end, the retraceSteps() method will be called. If it detects that the mazeGuy has reach the final position it will call Maze's printFinalMaze() method.The method also contains a Thread.sleep() to make the maze easier to view
        Parameters:
        currentXLocation - current x-position
        currentYLocation - current y-position
        lastMove - String containing the last move. The only point where the mazeGuy will need to reverse the direction it just came from is when it gets stuck in at a dead end, and if this happens the retraceStep() method will handle it.

      • retraceSteps

        private void retraceSteps(int currentXLocation,
                          int currentYLocation,
                          java.lang.String lastMove)
        This method is called whenever the maze guy reaches a dead end. It functions almost identically to the mazeTraversal() method, except it only follows paths made of "x"s and is constantly checking for a new path made of "."s. Because the path it's taking is already covered in "x"'s (or breadCrumbs). The breadCrumb() method will replace the "x"s with "o"s as it runs. The method also contains a Thread.sleep() to make the maze easier to view
        Parameters:
        currentXLocation - current x-location.
        currentYLocation - current y-location.
        lastMove - String containing the last move
